title: Remove MMR or make it visible
body:
Let's be honest. Your matchmaking is shit.

I dont believe in your SECRET formula of every team has 50% chance to win that is based on some SECRET data. THIS IS PURE BS. I can't believe people fall for it.

I want to have a clear understanding of whom I am being matched with, against and why.

replies.body: While I don't agree entirely with the conspiracy theory of the OP, I would like to see my own MMR. Upvoted
I think we should just be matched against people of our rank to make it abundantly clear to people whether they really belong where they are.  This is particularly relevant for series.

The problem is the MMR system is vastly superior to what a league rank based system would be.

So if this is an ultimatum, showing MMR is the better solution.

can you please explain how it is better?

playing against players ranked the same as yourself is how players advance in rank or determine their ranking

MMR is a value influenced only by win and loss, so if you end up with the RNG of 100 million people going the wrong way, it can be pretty hard to recover and also makes the experience worse for other players because the lower you are ranked by MMR, the easier it starts to become to overwhelm your opponents

the only justification I can think of for an MMR based system in a team game is to prevent boosting...which doesn't do much anyway

> [{quoted}](name=3TWarrior,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VRZuTyQ0,comment-id=0000000000020000,timestamp=2018-05-06T03:45:50.541+0000)
>
> playing against players ranked the same as yourself is how players advance in rank or determine their ranking

Because in the MMR system, you aren't ranked based on ranked, you're ranked based on performance. Rank itself is a superfluous medal awarded to the player that actually has near nothing to do with their actual MMR ranking.

It all really comes down to this question:

Do we want to be matched with players **based on our rank** or **based on our skill**?

Rank based matchmaking would result in huge win ratio shifts. Some will reach extremely high numbers (80%+) while others will reach extremely low numbers. Why does this happen? Because skill is no longer taken into account. We are essentially cutting the matchmaking algorithm from its current precision (say, 100%) to a fragment of it (~100 times smaller and less precise or 1% of what we currently have).

umm, how will skill not be taken into account?  if you are a certain rank, you should be playing against players of the same rank

that's why people don't want players starting off in silver

it has been stated that about 80% of the playerbase is bronze to silver, but how many of them earned silver?

it also eliminates the problem of having the system finding a "sweet spot" of players to play against you, whether you are of the proper rank or not

It's cuz we have a range of skill numbers (MMR) from ~800-~3000. That's 2200 increments of skill ranking.

Now for league divisions we have 5x5 + master and challenger. That's 27.

I don't think I needa explain why a system that ranks players into a range of 2200 "ranks" is better than 27 when it comes to skill-based matchmaking.

Also, 48.01% of the playerbase is Silver. Only 18.5% is Bronze. Even Gold is more populated than Bronze.
except that it uses an "average" and not a definite ranking to determine who gets into a match

An average of a much lower sample size.

You think that system wouldn't occasionally toss in Silver I's and Gold IV's into a Gold V game? Silver I's of which could have Silver 3 MMR from loss streaks that isn't taken into account because MMR doesn't exist in that system?

In the current system, Gold V MMR Silvers and Golds will be placed in the same game.

In the proposed one, you can have Silver III MMR Silver I's and Gold II MMR Gold IV's in the same game.

And do you have any idea how atrocious the Diamond+ queue times will be? Let alone Master+.

perhaps for lower elo, but Duo queueing is a thing.

So if a gold 1 and a silver 1 play together, they will be matched with gold 3's/gold 2's.

So in short if you want to fix that then you have to get arid of duo queueing.

Then you have another problem, at high elo people already wait a while.  Then they also get more insane skill gaps between players.

So yeah.

For duo queue you could make it match them up with players 2/3 of the way up from the worse player to the better player to encourage duoing with people around your skill level (harder to carry otherwise).

He's Silver 2 and won that game because I was fed as fuck, got the Darius ahead, and had unsealed spellbook so could take smite! It doesn't matter that he was bad, he's silver 2 and won and therefore we're even? MMR is important and the sooner that guy and people like him get out of my games the better.
And this isn't me being toxic at him for one mistake (We won, I got LP and haven't had to play with him since). It's me feeling bad for a guy that after face checking bushes for 30 minutes and dying from it 12 times, he still didn't think it was a bad idea (Definition: Insanity - Repeating the same action over and over while expecting a different result).

Lol, you can't remove MMR, MMR is the entire system...

The Division rank is all just flair.

Displaying MMR is fine though.

The whole League system is just a “feel good system”. 

The tiers and ranks feel meaningful. Feeling like “I’m Plat 3 and my friend is Gold 2” is a more significant comparison than “I’m 1890, and my friend 1650”. To 99% of people that means literally nothing. 

However being shown your MMR while keeping the rank system shouldn’t be a problem.

matchmaking rating...  from the elo system...  from chess...

> [{quoted}](name=MonarchVis,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VRZuTyQ0,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-05-04T11:21:30.153+0000)
>
> Wtf is MMR?

You MMR is a figure based on your winrate performance at any given level. The higher it is vs the average for your rank, the more LP you get to try and help you get to the point where your winrate is stable. The lower it is vs your average for your rank the more LP you lose.

Yes sometimes they can't balance the MMR perfectly and you get a lower TEAM MMR than your opponents, but then if you win then your MMR goes up and you get more LP for that game then you would. Similarly if your team has a higher team MMR than your opponents and you win then you get less LP (though this doesn't effect your MMR as it's "expected" the higher winrate players will win).

Some people believe it's all a conspiracy and they're playing alongside bronze players while the opponents have a couple of diamonds there, but the truth is macro pre diamond 4 is shaky at best, a myth at worst, tilt is rife and this is only made worse by the fact that without macro it's not about how good your best player is, but how bad your worst player is.

Elo hell is real, but it's made that way by these hidden Fakers that you get fed only for them to try to 1v5, get a kill and say "worth" as they kill the weakest enemy, or face-checking a bush rather than "wasting" a ward.

It's cancer

It determines how much LP you'll gain/lose

It's basically LP, but secretive; if you lose a game, you lose more MMR than LP, which means the next game you play will guarantee you'll lose even more or earn even less LP

It also claims to pair you up with people of the same MMR, so if you lose a game because of some inting morons, you'll be more likely to be put in a game with more inting morons on your team in the next game, and then the next, and then the next

That's also ELO hell in a nutshell

It is the hidden score for your wins/losses. The more MMR you have, the more LP you will gain/win and the less you have, the more you lose/loss. It's basically a system that is supposed to weed out players who don't belong in their current rank or raise ones that deserve a better rank. Don't know why it's hidden though.

I've been saying this for years now, what the fuck is the point of a ranking system if you are matched by a hidden MMR???

If you have Diamond MMR in Bronze (due to queue dodging and negative LP without affecting MMR for example), then your skill level is:

*drum roll*

DIAMOND.

You will be matched with other Diamonds, even though your rank says Bronze.

Thus, ranks are truly fucking useless and arbitrary, since your MMR is your actual skill level.

MMR should be visible, or even partially at least, like SC2 or DotA 2, or Overwatch even.

And promo series are completely fucking unnecessary in this system.

Remove promos inbetween divisions it makes this game unnecessarily grindy. 
Im 90Lp and win? Cool now i'm in division x 11LP or something and i still have a loss for free. 
Promos to the next higher tier are okay.

When i pruposely dropped out of diamond last season it took me 15 losses at d5 0LP to get to plat 1 it's ridiculous.

I'm not sure what purpose it would serve, but it would help prevent some of the toxic behaviors players see (even if it would not discourage them)

People obviously in those higher tiers play better obviously cause they wouldn't be there if they didn't. Or the lower tiers where people don't play AS WELL as the others in the game.

Then occasionally you got the "elo booster" or the smurf. All too common. You can literally buy accounts these days and just play ranked.

The smurfs and elo boosters play so well that they pretty much dominate every game they get into until they hit there elo. HOW IT SHOULD BE IS there should be "real mmr" and "smurf mmr". If you are let's say you are silver 2 smurf or elo boosting. Then you should also play against silver 2 players who are smurfing or elo boosting. IT SHOULD BE BALANCED but it's not. 

They put 2 good players on each team with a variety of other differently skilled set people. Too many variables to justify being balanced.

I haven't even played HOTS that much and i'm almost gold. BECAUSE GAMES ARE BALANCED PERIOD.

This is my last point, in chess, where MMR was actually developed. Gold 3 players play against gold 3 players. They don't put a fucking gold 3 against a plat player.

you can play against anyone in chess lol...

the point of the mmr system in chess isn't to match people but to create a ranked ladder and gauge the gains/losses after a match

if your mmr is a lot lower than your opponent and you win, you gain a lot of points (you steal some of his points), if you lose, your opponent barely gain anything etc..
And when I say to people that MMR is a lie and that we never almost get 50% chances to win, they say I'm stupid and it's bullshit. In your face now idiots!
